overview: The walls, floor and ceiling of a classroom are painted red. A girl appears and holds up a red piece of paper with the words "A woman who should never have been given a name in the first place" written on it. From this point on, a dozen or so high school students act out a play and a flood of words using the red drawing paper begins, and a spy drama proceeds simultaneously. The film is an homage to Godard and Kurosawa Kiyoshi, and is notable for its forceful narrative, which seems to want to destroy the film.
title: HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT MOVIE
